intro: Caladenia oenochila, commonly known as the pink-stemmed spider-orchid, is an orchid species native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stem and its striking, pinkish-red flowers that resemble spiders, hence its common name. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Caladenia oenochila is a terrestrial orchid with a single, erect flowering stem that bears one to three flowers. It is part of the Caladenia genus, which is known for its intricate and often colorful floral structures.
